career.info: I love what I am doing. I am currently working on building the next biggest baddest software system. Being challenged is just the way I like it.

Designing project mockups using Figma & Sketch
Built and designed RCS’s current website
Refactoring code to make life cleaner, slimpler, & plain old better

career.info: After two years of settling, I finally decided to quit my job and join The Iron Yard. It has been the best decision. During this 12 week bootcamp I was able to strengthen my JavaScript skills, sharpen my ability to refactor code, and build my  collaboration skills.
duties: Programmed websites using JavaScript, JQuery, MVC frameworks, Sass, and APIs
Built variety of apps such as a music playlist, interactive games, and complex dashboard
Collaborated weekly on group projects which led to working web applications
Designed all personal and group project mockups using Sketch

career.info: I am very proud of this position. I developed the SharePoint department from nothing to now an onboarding process for OnPar. I did everything from interviewing the client to creating custom workflows and forms.
duties: Implemented SharePoint design and development projects for clients
Performed live training and webinars on Microsoft SharePoint
Developed email marketing campaigns, e-newsletters, and blogs

career.info: I owe OnPar a lot of thank yous. This is when I was able to find out what I truly love to do. Being a small company, I was able to wear many hats and strengthen different roles which included project management, development, and admin duties.
duties: Provided input on company’s strategies, processes, and procedures
Leveraged graphic design skills to create over 40 marketing collateral
Promoted company through marketing collateral, social media, and events
